# Analysis of âš¡â”‚general Discord Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat segment contains minimal technical discussion. The main technical point is that Hyperfy 2.0 uses a completely different engine from the legacy version (v1), making it impossible to copy/paste worlds between versions. A user seeking guidance on accessing the new platform was directed to the documentation quickstart guide. The conversation also included some casual exchanges about a "new fridge" but contained very little substantive technical content overall.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Are we able to copy paste a world from legacy to 2.0? (asked by Harambe Advocate) A: Nope completely different engine. v1 was super intertwined with the platform itself, v2 is freedom. (answered by ash)
Q: I am confused on how to get to the new platform and use it. Does it require a server? (asked by Harambe Advocate) A: This is a good place to start: https://docs.hyperfy.xyz/welcome/quickstart/ (answered by Gert-Jan Akerboom)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Helpee: Harambe Advocate | Context: User confused about how to access and use the new Hyperfy platform | Resolution: Provided documentation link to the quickstart guide
Helper: ash | Helpee: Harambe Advocate | Context: User asking if worlds can be copied from legacy to 2.0 | Resolution: Explained that it's not possible due to different engines

## 4. Action Items
Documentation: Review/update documentation for migrating from v1 to v2 | Mentioned By: ash
Documentation: Ensure quickstart guide adequately addresses new user onboarding questions | Mentioned By: Gert-Jan Akerboom

# Analysis of ðŸ’»â”‚developers Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat segment is very brief and contains minimal technical discussion. The main technical point raised by ash is about Fly.io's temporary file system, noting that when the service shuts down, the file system is lost. Ash recommends using a persistent volume for data that needs to survive shutdowns. There's also a mention of a pull request to the Hyperfy repository (PR #147) that ash commends. The rest of the messages consist of reaction GIFs and a brief confirmation message ("that was it!").

## 2. FAQ
Q: How does Fly.io handle file storage? (asked by ash) A: Fly provides a temporary file system that disappears when the service shuts down; persistent volumes are needed for data that should survive shutdowns (answered by ash)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: ash | Helpee: untitled, xyz | Context: Issue with Fly.io file persistence | Resolution: Suggested using persistent volumes instead of temporary file system

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Review and potentially merge PR #147 at hyperfy-xyz/hyperfy repository | Mentioned By: ash
Technical: Implement persistent volumes for Fly.io deployments | Mentioned By: ash
